fields.description:
h3. Summary
Webhooks aren't being triggered when [custom events|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/custom-events-868983028.html] are associated with workflow steps.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a custom event as detailed on this documentation page: [Adding a custom event|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/adding-a-custom-event-776636672.html]
2. Choose a transition to create a workflow [post function|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/advanced-workflow-configuration-776636620.html] as follows:
{code}
Fire a <your custom Event here> event that can be processed by the listeners. 
{code}
3. Set a webhook condition to fire when an issue is transitioned to the workflow transition associated with the custom event 
4. Transition the issue
5. Webhook will not be triggered and no payload will be received

h3. Expected Results
The webhook feature should work with custom events added to post functions.

h3. Actual Results
Workflow steps associated with custom events are not triggering the webhook feature.

h3.Workaround
Workaround is to set an additional post function (*Trigger a Webhook* post function) to trigger the webhook explicitly: 

 !trigger a webhook.png|thumbnail! 

* Video showing how to set the additional post function in details: https://www.screencast.com/t/mcnhLvrA
fields.summary: Webhooks aren't being fired when workflow transitions are associated with custom events in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira Cloud is sending an invalid User-Agent header in HTTP requests to our add-on. The HTTP requests include the lifecycle events: Installed, Enabled; as well as other user-initiated requests and web hooks.

User-Agent: Atlassian HttpClient unknown / JIRA-1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT (100059) / Default

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make an HTTP request. Can be encountered in lifecycle events.

h3. Expected Results
Valid user-agent value

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Illegal header: Illegal 'user-agent' header: Invalid input '/', expected WSP, CRLF, product-or-comment or 'EOI' (line 1, column 64): Atlassian HttpClient unknown / JIRA-1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT (100059) / Atlassian-Connect/1.3.238
{noformat}

h3. Notes
It appears that the application server is choking on the second '/' in the `User-Agent` string.
fields.summary: Invalid User-Agent header being sent to add-ons

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Issues In Progress gadget - https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira062/adding-the-in-progress-gadget-588581655.html do not return any results if your workflow status is not in English.
As the gadget use the query *{{status = 'In Progress' AND resolution is EMPTY AND assignee = currentUser() ORDER BY priority DESC, created ASC}}* you cannot edit this query to be compatible to 'In Progress' status of a different language.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to users to select which status is the 'In Progress' the gadget need to keep track.

h3. Why this is important
There is an increasing number of customers using Jira on their native languages, and certain features like this gadget won't work as expected if they work only in English.
 
h3. Workaround 
Create a custom filter *{{status = '<Your In Progress Status>' AND resolution is EMPTY AND assignee = currentUser() ORDER BY priority DESC, created ASC}}* and use the *Filter Results* gadget - https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/adding-the-filter-results-gadget-720416922.html
fields.summary: Improve the language support of the Issues In Progress gadget

fields.description:
As a JIRA Administrator I would like to have the ability to assign users Project Admin rights but have the option to select which admin rights they can have.  Similar to Confluence permissions setup where there are checkboxes for each permission to select and de-select specific areas that they have control over (Components Section, Versions, Users/Project Role assignment, add new users to project, etc...).  

 

Example: We have a few "know-it-all" (or so they think) Scrum Masters and Product Owners who in the past have had Project Admin rights and just added everybody and their mother to the project... in turn the project got overloaded with too many cooks in the kitchen causing a huge mess.  

 

I would still like these people to be able to create Versions and Components or have the option to take an individual right away.  Basically break down the Admin permissions into individual permissions to avoid abuse of the "Administer Project" permission.  I really think that all the permissions should be check boxes as this would be much easier to assign as a whole.  

 

Thanks,

David Eakle (JIRA Genie)

JIRA Administrator

Maersk Line Inc.
fields.summary: Checkboxes: Select/De-select specific PROJECT Admin rights OR All permissions for multiple users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira allows admins to multiple create custom fields with the same name.  The custom fields appear as duplicates even though they are separate fields.

JQL field searching example: 
!Screen Shot 2017-09-21 at 2.55.37 PM.png|thumbnail! 

There are 2 custom fields with the same name, but they are completely different fields.

h3. Suggested Solution
Do not allow Jira to create multiple custom fields with the same name - each custom field must have a unique name.

h3. Why this is important
Having multiple custom fields can be confusing, espescially when searching fields or deleting custom fields.
 
h3. Workaround 
No known workarounds.
fields.summary: Jira allows admins to create custom fields with the same name

h3. Summary

We are expecting custom field's description to be updated based on our preferred language, but it doesn't at the moment

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

# Create your JIRA Cloud instance with Spanish language
# Create Software projects
# You noticed that some of those Custom Fields are translated in Spanish

The Custom Field description changed to English, which is my current preferred language. Refer to screenshot:  
!JIRA_CLOUD_ERROR_TRANSLATE.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
I have several projects in my JIRA Cloud instance and I'm working across those projects constantly during the day. When I'm in a project looking at the backlog and hit the "c" on my keyboard, in most cases I'm wanting to create a new issue in the project I'm looking at.

Unfortunately, JIRA currently defaults to creating the issue in the last project I created an issue in. That's nice, but that was two hours ago when I was in the support project, now I'm looking at my product backlog so that's where I want to add the new issue.

I'm sure there are many other users out there like me who constantly find themselves swearing and moving issue that have inadvertently been created in the wrong project.
fields.summary: Default project for creating new issues should be the project I'm currently in

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The want to be able to easily sort the stepname ID of the workflow position as this then can allow the user to point to a default status when moving an issue from one project to another, in the current situations. When the user is doing the move issue from one project to another, the default status that is prompted is based on the very first stepname ID of the workflow, the user wants the ability to sort this and put a different stepname ID in the first position, so it's easier to pick as it will point to the first stepname ID by default, quickening the moving issue action for the user.
h3. Sample Picture

 The positioning of the status in the workflow:
!step02.png|width=942,height=264!

 The positioning of the status in the Move Issue screen:
h3. !image-2017-09-20-22-32-08-588.png|width=924,height=229!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the ability to sort the position of the stepname (id) in the workflow without affecting the workflow transition between one status to another. The sorting ability only affects the positioning of the status when appearing throughout the JIRA application dropdown menu from where the user can choose from.
h3. Why this is important

This sorting ability, furthers speeds up the process/action that relies on choosing the status of the workflow from a drown menu. In the user's case this can be applied to moving issues. The workaround would be too destructive as it would require the user to delete and remove the existing transitions and status and recreate them based on the required sorting needed.
fields.summary: Ability to Sort The Workflow Step Name ID Position

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi everyone,

Let me shed some light behind this issue.

I confirm that the change of _maxResults_ value for search API was intentional and it’s not a bug. We decided to reduce the _maxResults_ value not only due to increased performance and memory impact on Jira but also after observing the volume of REST API requests that were unfinished because of timeout errors. Whilst we appreciate that the solution may not be ideal to the problem, and we keep investing into improving the performance of Jira searches, it was necessary to reduce the number of failed API requests without further delay.

According to [Atlassian REST API policy|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/HOME/Atlassian+REST+API+policy?_ga=2.11471671.2024100639.1505889530-892835306.1502362635#AtlassianRESTAPIpolicy-Resource/ratelimitsandpaging] default and maximum sizes of paged data are not considered part of the API and may change without deprecation notice. But I completely understand the impact this change caused to REST API clients that relied on the anticipated value of 1000 results and I apologize for lack of prior communication.

In principle, our recommended solution is to rely on [pagination|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/?_ga=2.15756085.2024100639.1505889530-892835306.1502362635#pagination] to retrieve the desired number of results in chunks for any API that supports _startAt_ parameter. We also recommend that REST API clients systematically confirm _maxResults_ value when making the requests to prevent disruptions whenever these limits change. That being said, we updated the related [Knowledge Base article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-maxresults-parameter-for-jira-rest-api-779160706.html], which was inaccurately suggesting the default value of response results to be 1000.

Regarding the problems for _startAt_ offset above 1000 in combination with expanded changelog, we need to investigate them as separate issue (see JRACLOUD-67458).

\\
 Thank you for your understanding.

 Eve Stankiewicz
 Jira Cloud Product Management

{panel}

h3. Summary

JIRA Cloud REST API /rest/api/latest/search?maxResults=1000 is returning only 100 results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call to a REST API with maxResults = 1000

h3. Expected Results

The API returns all issues until 1000 results.
h3. Actual Results

The API returns only 100 results.
h3. Notes:

This is impacting add-on dashboards and reporting.

[Changing maxResults Parameter for JIRA REST API|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-maxresults-parameter-for-jira-rest-api-779160706.html].
h3. Workaround

You can use the *startAt* parameter to get the other results (if more than 100 are returned). /search endpoint implements [pagination api|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#pagination] which can be used to retrieve all the required data
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud REST API /rest/api/latest/search?maxResults=1000 is returning only 100 results.
In JIRA comments images should fit to width

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The issue does not show the transitions associated with the issue type.
Using the post function *Set field value (JMWE add-on)* to change the issue type of a JIRA issue to an issue type that does not use the same workflow, causes the issue to be bugged with wrong transitions.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# Create a workflow (e.g Workflow 1)
# Assign an issue type to this workflow (e.g Issue type 1)
# Create a second workflow (e.g Workflow 2)
# Assign another issue type to this second workflow (e.g Issue type 2)
# In a transition in the Workflow 1, create a post function *Set field value (JMWE add-on)* and in the _Field_ select *Issue type*. In the _Value_, select the issue type *Issue type 2* of the Workflow 2.

Create a test issue and transition the post function you created.
The issue will change its issue type (to Issue type 2), however, it will be stuck in the same workflow (Workflow 1), causing the issue to be in a "bugged status".  

h3. Expected Results
* It should Fail if the issue type is not in the same workflow.

h3. Notes
Use this query to check the workflow the issue is currently in
{code}select * from os_wfentry where id = (select workflow_id from jiraissue where issuenum = 1234 and project = (select id from project where pkey = 'ABC'));{code}

h3. Workaround
In order to update the issue type value of a JIRA Ticket to a type that does not use the same workflow, the issue must be *moved* instead.
fields.summary: Post function "Set field value - Issue Type" should fail if the issue types do not share the same workflow

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing from a JIRA Server 7.5.0 that has a custom field with values set the import fails. This does not happen if importing from JIRA 7.4.x or earlier.

This is because previous versions of JIRA added lines like this to every custom field value:
{code}<CustomFieldValue id="10001" issue="10000" customfield="10007" stringvalue="10001"/>{code}

However, in 7.5.0, the {{updated}} value is added:
{code}<CustomFieldValue id="10000" issue="10000" customfield="10007" updated="1505744146369" stringvalue="10000"/>{code}

JIRA is expecting a date format for 'updated', not a number and it fails with either of these two errors:
# Error 1
#* Errors

# Error 2
#* Import error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Recently, the Bitbucket import have been removed from Cloud.
We are having an increasing in support tickets asking for this feature, so we are raising this feature to ask for the importer to be implemented for the new version of Cloud.

h3. Workaround 
Use a Server version of JIRA:
* Migrate from Bitbucket:
* Migrate to Cloud using JIRA Backup Export/Import.
fields.summary: Make available in the External System Import the Bitbucket import

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to add watchers using multiple browsers (reproduced on Safari and Firefox).
h3. Affected Versions

*JIRA*
 - JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

*Safari*
 * Version 10.1.2 - OS X El Capitan
 * Version 10.12.6 - OS Sierra

*Firefox*
 * Version 54.0.1 (64-bit)
 * Version 55.0.3 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue
 # In the Watchers field, click on the number to add a watcher

h3. Expected Results

Open the box to search a user and add as a watcher.

 
 !Watchers_Expected_Results.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The box is not opened.

 

!Watchers_Actual_Results.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Using Google Chrome seems to be working fine.
fields.summary: Unable to add watchers using multiple browsers.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Change your JIRA interface to the new experience
# Go to System

h3. Expected Results

Find the option to set an Announcement Banner under 'User Interface'.

h3. Actual Results

There are only the following options:

 !Screen Shot 2017-09-18 at 10.02.55 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workarounds

Disable the New JIRA Experience in the profile.
fields.summary: Annoucement Banner option missing in the New JIRA Experience

fields.description:
JIRA today determines no of licensable users for add-ons based on total user count on the system. This is a problem especially when the add-on does not apply to some users in the system.

e.g. We are evaluating Zephyr for JIRA and ZAPI for our test case management, and will likely not buy them since JIRA charges for all of our users. We are now forced to  buy an API license for every single user when in reality there are only 2 automated application who will talk to them.

The funny thing is Atlassian support advised us to reduce our JIRA users to match our Zephyr users, which in reality means take 95% of our users out of JIRA :)

Thanks
fields.summary: Ability to license add-ons for a subset of  jira users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Creating a Scrum or Kanban project fails on a JIRA application with the default language set to Italian.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Cog Menu > System > General Configuration > Edit Settings
# Set the *Default language* to *italianio(Italia)*
# Projects Menu > Create Project
# Choose Scrum or Kanban software development and create the project.


h3. Expected Results

The project should be created.

h3. Actual Results

Project created fails with the error : {{Hmm... we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page to start again.}}

 !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Set the *Default Language* setting to something else other than *italianio(Italia)*.
fields.summary: Cannot create Kanban / Scrum project with Italian default language

fields.description:
Currently, the information about add-ons compatibility is not well presented to the customers when doing import/export from Cloud to Server and vice versa. Customers have no clue about some functions related to add-ons that are available in Cloud but might not be available in Server and this turns out caused customers a lot of pain and creates frictions for customers who are doing migration.

To reduce frictions and to create a smooth migration experience, it will be good if we can inform the customers about add-ons compatibility between Cloud and Server before doing migration, so the customers are better informed and can make a better decision whether or not to proceed with the migration.
fields.summary: Improve communication process about add-ons compatibility between Cloud and Server when doing import/export

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If we use the {{Update Issue Custom Field}} post-function in JIRA to set a custom field value, JIRA will actually only find the issue if we search for its old value, ignoring this new value set.

This issue also occurs whenever a custom field is updated upon a workflow transition screen. As an example, if a custom field has *no value* and is updated during a transition, searching for the new value will not return the expected issue. This *does not* include the issue creation screen.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
||In Post-Function||In Workflow Transition||
|# Create a custom field (only tested with single line text), say 'Test Field'
# Add a project and add that a post-function to a transition setting the value of field to 'Text2'
# Create a ticket in the project and set its custom field value to 'Text1'
# Search for {{"Test Field" = 'Text1'}} and {{"Test Field" = 'Text2'}}
# Transition ticket using the transition that sets the field (field value must be changed to 'Text'2')
# Do again search for {{"Test Field" = 'Text1'}} and {{"Test Field" = 'Text2'}}| # Create a custom field
 # Add it to a screen
 # Associate this screen with a workflow transition 
 # Create an issue *without* populating this field
 # Transition issue and populate the field
 # Query for the new field value|


h3. Expected Results
The ticket is only found in {{"Test Field" = 'Text1'}} in first search, before setting the field, and only found in {{"Test Field" = 'Text2'}} after it.

h3. Actual Results
The ticket is found in {{"Test Field" = 'Text1'}} in both cases, even after setting the field to 'Text2'.
 
h3. Notes
This does not happen if we set the field by editing the issue.

h3. Workaround:
 * Editing custom field value manually makes it searchable once again
 * Setting custom field on issue creation screen (if applicable) also works.
fields.summary: Changing issue via post-function/workflow transition prevents search from working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When experiencing the new look and feel, the issues listing in *ISSUE FILTER* do not show the status with the correct color.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
** using the new JIRA experience.
# Add to a dashboard the ISSUE Filter
# Add the status field
# Save 

!Screen Shot 2017-09-14 at 18.01.57.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
Display the issues and status with the real status color.
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-14 at 18.06.48.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
Issues listing with the status in Blue or Black.
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-14 at 18.01.57.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Remove the new Look and feel.
fields.summary: Status color looking different at new Look and feel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the *Projects* gadget, the drop-down list available on the 'menu' icon isn't being displayed correctly. 

h3. Environment
Cloud - Cloud - JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a *Projects* type gadget to a JIRA dashboard
# Click on the 'menu' icon as illustrated on the following documentation page from JIRA Server: [Adding the Projects Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/adding-the-projects-gadget-720416898.html/]
# Verify the available options

h3. Expected Results
The following links should be available when clicking on the menu icon: 

* Summary 
* Issues 
* Versions
* Components
* Builds 
* Source 
* Reviews 

h3. Actual Results
Only the *calendar* and *issues* options are available, but the last one isn't showing up correctly either, being placed behind the calendar option.

 !menu_issues.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Gadget Projects: Links on the 'menu' icon aren't showing up correctly on the menu's drop-down list

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking on the title of the *Projects* gadget, a link will send the user to www.atlassian.com:

 !title link.png|thumbnail! 

This happens by default, even when the gadget's name isn't customised:

 !title link 2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a *Projects* type gadget to a JIRA dashboard
# Click on the Gadget's upper bar (where a custom title can be placed) 
# You'll be redirected to www.atlassian.com

h3. Expected Results
A link should not be placed on the gadget's upper bar. A user can be redirected by mistake when trying to rearrange the dashboard.

h3. Actual Results
If the user ends up clicking on the link by mistake he will be automatically sent to www.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Gadget Projects: Title is hyperlinked to www.atlassian.com

-  [^Bug_Thumbnail_Gif.mp4]

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some searches in some instances using labels may be very inefficient. In _some_ instances, we can see:
{code}labels not in (<list of labels>) OR labels in (<list of labels>){code}

This may not be inefficient in all instances or for all labels, though, that depends on the search JIRA will need to make.

If it is inefficient, it may simply break the board related to it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create inefficient search
# Add as a filter to board

h3. Expected Results
Both search and board respond fast.

h3. Actual Results
Search and board are very slow, and sometimes fail to load with errors
{noformat}
Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again.
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
h4. Partial workaround
When possible, do different searches, without labels.
fields.summary: Unefficient label searches my break searches and boards

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Project Settings > Workflow
# Click on transition from status A to B
# Add a transition screen to ask the user to enter linked issues
# Add a validator > Fields Required and enter linked issues
# Transition the issue from status A to B
# In the transition screen, enter linked issues

h3. Expected Results
The issue can be transitioned successfully

h3. Actual Results
There is an error message that states that linked issues is required. It seems that the validator doesn't check for the linked issues that was entered in the transition screen
fields.summary: Validator 'Fields Required' doesn't work with Linked Issues
Updating the remaining estimate using REST API calls also updates the original estimate

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is a typo in the spelling of "transition". It was spelt as "transistion" (wrong) instead of "transition" (correct). After the workflow condition ("Block transition until approval") is added, when viewing the conditions tab under a transition we can see a typo in the spelling of "Transition". The text is ("Issue transistion will be blocked if there is a *pending* approval".)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Got settings select issue
 * under workflows, select workflows
 * pick any Active/inactive workflow and edit it
 * pick any Transition and click it
 * under the conditions tab click add condtion
 * select the second option ("Block transition until approval") and click add
 * on returning to the transition screen check the conditions tab for the added condition.
 * you should now see "Issue transistion will be blocked if there is a *pending* approval"

h3. Expected Results

"Issue transition will be blocked if there is a *pending* approval".

Take note of the spelling of *transition*
h3. Actual Results

"Issue transistion will be blocked if there is a *pending* approval".

Take note of the spelling of *transition*
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Typo after selecting workflow condition "Block transition until approval"

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have more options that I could choose when setting up how the Slack integration would display *issue previews*.

Add-on: [JIRA Cloud for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.slack/cloud/overview]

Currently, there are two options available for issue previews: 

* Clean
* Compact

I would like to choose which JIRA fields would be displayed on issue previews. For example, I'd like to display only the issue key, status and issue's description.
fields.summary: I'd like to have more flexibility to choose how issue previews are displayed on Slack channels

fields.description: When a user is opening a ticket through the Customer Portal (NVDA + Firefox) and does not fill a required field, it does not warn the user what is the missing field. It's necessary to go one by one using TAB to find where the issue is.
fields.summary: Accessibility - Required fields does not warn users when using NVDA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA keeps resizing when you move the mouse over the Time field when you use the Calendar of any date time Picker field, causing an annoying bug.

The error only occurs using the German Language on Safari Browser.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a Date Time Picker custom field and add it to the create issue screen of any project
 * Change on your *profile* the JIRA Language to *Deutsch*
 * Click to create a new issue using the project you added the custom field
 * In the create issue Screen, Click in the Calendar at the right side of the field and move your mouse over the time field

h3. Expected Results

The Calendar keeps in the same size and you should be able to change the time.
h3. Actual Results

Due to the notes returned below the calendar, the calendar resizes and keep doing it until you click at the time. (Check attached GIF)
h3. Workaround

Click in the resized time stops the bug.
fields.summary: JIRA Date-time picker calendar resizing on Safari when using German Language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to assign issues on the new issue detail view of a board doesn't save the assignee.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a business or software board with the new issue detail view.
# Open an issue card.
# Try to assign the issue.

h3. Expected Results
The issue assignee should be saved.

h3. Actual Results
The issue does not save the assignee and the below error can be found in the browser console:
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"assignee":"User 'example@atlassian.com' does not exist."}}
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Not all users are impacted by this.

h3.Workaround
Enter the issue full details page and you should be able to assign it there.

fields.description:
*Problem Description*
When running Long Running Tasks that last more than 60 seconds, such as issue loading (a lot of comment) or changing scheme etc. It potentially hitting Nginx's 60-second timeout Shows as Page Not Available.

*Suggested Solution*
Provide more informative message during the 60 second time out so the users are aware that the operation takes too long to complete than misunderstood that something in the application is broken.
fields.summary: Improve Nginx's 60-second timeout message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Custom Events do not trigger a notification in HipChat room.

h3. Environment
Cloud JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom event in JIRA
# In your workflow, set a post function in a transition to fire the custom event created in #1
# In your project's HipChat integration menu, select a HipChat room and click Add
# Select "issue transitioned to" and select the transition from #2

Test by transitioning the issue.

h3. Expected Results
The HipChat room should be notified.

h3. Notes
The same steps above (Steps to reproduce) will work if you select a system event (generic event, issue updated, etc) instead of a custom event.

h3. Workaround
Use the post function *Notify HipChat*.
fields.summary: Notifications from JIRA Custom Events not working

fields.description:
As a user, I'm concerned about providing administrative permissions to all add-ons installed on my instance. 

In February a change on how add-on permissions are given to JIRA projects was made. This resulted in all JIRA projects now having a new project role called *atlassian-addons-project-access* on all project's permission schemes. More details about this change on the following link: 

* [Add-on permissions update|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/02/add-on-permissions-update] 

Now, when installing an add-on, it will automatically receive the *Administer projects* permission on all projects. I'd like to request the reviewing of this decision, as it seems that giving this permission to all add-ons might be unnecessary.
fields.summary: Please review if the Administer projects permission must be granted to project role atlassian-addons-project-access by default

fields.description:
Hello,

Currently I have a lot of tickets on my backlog which are dependant on other tickets being solved first. We create in those tickets the relation 'ticket X requires ticket Y'.

But I have not found a mechanism in which I can see on the backlog that ticket X can be picked up because ticket Y has been solved already. So is there a way in which I can see on the backlog that the required ticket has been solved? For example by automatically change the apperance of the ticket visually similar to adding a flag.

E-mail notifications are not a solution for me in this case since my mailbox is already overflooding and then I would still need to change something in the ticket in Jira myself (or drag it up) to make it clear it can be picked up in one of the upcoming sprint plannings.

I haven't found a ticket about this and would like to know if there is already a solution for tracking this situation. Otherwise I would like to the opinions about how other product owners manage this relation.
fields.summary: Visual change of ticket on backlog when required ticket is closed

fields.description:
h2. Summarry
On endpoints which search for users (assignable, mentionable, username searching etc) there are significant performance issues (20-30sec spent searching in the worst cases) on instances which have a large number of users. 

h2. Environment
All JIRA Cloud

h2. Steps to reproduce
1. Have an instance with at least ~1000 users
2. Try to access /rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search 
3. It will take a long time or timeout

h2. Expected Results
The results are fetched without timing out or taking a long time

h2. Actual Results
The application timeouts or takes a long time

h2. Workaround
None
fields.summary: On instances with large user count performance for user searches is bad

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 16 August 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Project admins can now create and assign their project's key when they create a new project! 🙌 
Based on the project's name, Jira suggests a recognizable key. Project admins can customize this while creating a project, by selecting Advanced options. And, they can update it at anytime in their project's settings. Read more about editing a project's details. See here for more info about issues and project keys – https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/working-with-issues-765593800.html
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 April 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
When we redesigned the project creation experience as part of the new Jira UI, we made a decision to automatically generate project keys in an effort to streamline project creation as much as possible. Based on your feedback over the last few months, we now know that we underestimated the importance of getting the project key right from the beginning. We are planning to re-introduce the ability to set the project key during project creation as soon as possible.

We will provide another update on this request when we start to roll out this update. We regret the inconvenience caused and thanks again for your patience.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
Jira Cloud Product Management
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In the new Jira Cloud experience, users are no longer able to specify a project key whenever they create a new project. Instead, a project key is automatically created based off the project name. For organizations with a specific naming convention, this is undesirable.

h3. Expected behavior
Users are able to set a project key before the project is created and new schemes are generated.

h3. Workaround
You can change the project key immediately after project creation by going to Project Settings > Details.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to be able to specify the project key when creating a new project in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence gadgets cannot be used in Jira dashboards in Cloud environment.
As mentioned in the documentation below, this is only applicable on Server:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf51/adding-a-confluence-gadget-to-a-jira-dashboard-336169240.html/

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable the functionality to add Confluence gadgets to a Jira dashboard for Cloud users.

h3. Why this is important
This would improve the integration between applications reducing the need of the customer to go back and forth between Jira and Confluence to check certain information.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Enable adding Confluence gadgets to Jira dashboards on Cloud.

fields.description:
h3. Description

Some users would like to be able to disable this feature.

 
h3. Suggested resolution:

Example:

See screenshot 
!ios_spam.png|thumbnail!
h3.
fields.summary: Ability to hide the 'sent from mobile' message

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Import from Server to Cloud fails
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export JIRA Server
 # Import the file on JIRA Cloud

h3. Expected Results

Import finishes successfully
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Non recoverable error during cloudImport: Import task failed: [The upgrade task manager has returned a non-successful result from running the upgrades]
{noformat}
h3. Notes

 

Similar to bug JRACLOUD-67130
h3. Workaround
# In splunk, find the affected build number
{code}
{	[-]	
  	 @laas:	{	[+]	
  	}	
  	 @timestamp:	 2017-11-08T01:33:44.854Z	
  	 ctx:	{	[+]	
  	}	
  	 ec2:	{	[+]	
  	}	
  	 env:	 prod-east	
  	 ext:	{	[+]	
  	}	
  	 host:	 ip-10-124-137-59.useast.atl-inf.io	
  	 hostname:	 fe02da372311	
  	 level:	 ERROR	
  	 location:	{	[+]	
  	}	
  	 logger:	 cloud.atlassian.upgrade.core.DefaultUpgradeTaskFactoryProcessor	
  	 m:	{	[+]	
  	}	
  	 message:	 Cannot downgrade as there is an upgrade task for factory (host) and build number (73011) that has not completed	
  	 pid:	 32	
  	 product:	 jira	
  	 thread:	 pool-53-thread-1	
  	 time:	 2017-11-08T01:33:44Z	
  	 timestamp:	 2017-11-08T01:33:44,854Z	
}
{code}
# Search for the upgrade history id in *entities.xml* file that has the affected build number
example:

<UpgradeTaskHistory id="10005" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="host" buildNumber="73011" status="FAILED" upgradeType="SERVER"/>
{code}
{code}
<UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog id="10005" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="host" buildNumber="73011" status="FAILED" upgradeType="SERVER" timeperformed="2017-10-31 10:47:00.097" action="upgrade"/>

fields.description:
h2. Summary
The autocomplete behaviour for components is limited and should provide more options.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
When creating or editing an issue, the search works from the first letter of a word in the component. As an example, please refer below:

{quote}
*Component name*: *Component One*
*Component name*: *Component-Two*
{quote}

# *Component One* has two words; thus typing *c* or *o* will show it.
# *Component-Two* is treated as one word; thus typing only *c* will show it.

h2. Expected Results
# For *Component One* and *Component-Two*, typing any letter (in the component) should show it (plus any other components with the letter). The component options should narrow down as more letters are typed.

h2. Actual Results
# For *Component One*, typing *c* or *o* will show it.
# For, *Component-Two*, typing only *c* will show it.

h4. Note from a customer:
{quote}
I notice that Component and Label both behave the way you described.
However, Epic behaves differently (and this is the behaviour I would prefer Component and Label to have). For example, if I have an epic named ews-client-python, autocomplete will suggest it if I type "p" in the Epic field. In fact, it will even auto-suggest ewsClientPython.
{quote}
fields.summary: Better autocomplete support for components

fields.description:
The more webhooks installed for a tenant the slower that issue updates are. This affects people when they are doing bulk work and when they have many webhooks installed, with the worst cases occurring when both conditions are met.

Webhook callouts are already performed asynchronously, and at this stage evidence points towards event serialisation as being the main bottleneck here.

Things to look at first:
* improve performance of serialisation itself
* background serialization of webhooks
fields.summary: Improve performance of webhooks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to change an issue type scheme to remove an issue type from example. It's necessary to select the new issue type that you want to set to the issues since you're removing the current issue type that the issues are associated. Once selected, a bulk operation starts to change the issue type and if there are over 200 issues to be updated, the bulk operations times out without completing the change. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a single issue type to over 400 issues
# Remove the issue type from the issue type scheme and select a new issue type for the issues

h3. Expected Results
The bulk process will complete and all the issues will be updated accordingly

h3. Actual Results
The bulk operation times out and the process isn't completed

h3.Workaround
Bulk change the issue type in a small batch of issues.
fields.summary: Change issue type scheme times out if there's over 200 affected by the change

fields.description:

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom filter, and select certain columns to appear in the 'Filter' section:
!Screen Shot 2017-09-07 at 14.48.42.png|thumbnail! 
# Save the filter and set to public.
# Log as a different user and try to load the saved filter.
# Choose your own columns under 'My Defaults' section.
!Screen Shot 2017-09-07 at 14.57.26.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

h3.Workaround

fields.summary: Column selection on Issue Search is lost while using a custom filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Rearrange gadgets or change dashboard layout is failing if the dashboard has either Service Desk gadgets and the dashboard owner is not an agent, or just any broken Jira gadget.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Service Desk gadget to dashboard
 # Remove the Service Desk permission from the dashboard owner

h3. Expected Results
The gadget is shown on UI informing the user doesn't have Service Desk permission.

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Sorry, your changes to this dashboard could not be saved. Your dashboard may be out of sync with the server: please reload the page.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Depending on the root-cause, either:  
* Grant Service Desk permission to the owner of the dashboard. Once the dashboard is updated, the permission can be revoked.
* Remove the broken gadget (this is not always possible since the broken gadget may be not displaying on the dashboard and can only be removed from DB. In this case contact Atlassian Support by logging a support request in [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Rearrange gadgets or change dashboard layout is failing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While accessing issues directly or through software boards users are able to see all the users from the assignee field even when they don't have the _Browse Users_ permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Either create a user ensuring that he doesn't have the "Browse Users" permission or remove the permission from your user.
# Enter any issue and load the possible assignees.

h3. Expected Results
The user shouldn't be able to browse through all the site users.

h3. Actual Results
The user is able to see all the users on the site.

h3. Notes
For some reason, the issue is not reproducible on business boards using the Board issue details lab feature.
Also, the bug does not happen in boards using the new issue detail view.
fields.summary: Browse Users permission not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we set a due date in an issue, it will show fine in the view issue screen. However, JIRA Issue Calendar gadget will show the due date to be two days before, while any other gadgets that pull in due dates will show them as one day before.

The same behavior is also noticed in the Issue Search, without using filters - the due date is off by one day:
 !issue-search.png|thumbnail!

The correct date as depicted in the issue view:
 !issue-view.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # put the Due Date (upon creation) to be Sep. 4th.
 # But in the Calendar Widget it shows as Sep 2nd.
 # And in the Filter Results widget it shows as Sep. 3rd.

h3. Expected Results
 * Calendar Widget shows as Sep 4th
 * Filter Results widget shows as Sep 4th

h3. Actual Results
 * Calendar Widget shows as Sep 2nd
 * Filter Results widget shows as Sep 3rd

h3. Workaround

None at the moment
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Calendar Gadget and Gadgets With Filters Are Showing Wrong "Due Date" values

fields.description:

QuickCreate/Edit dialog *always* shows "Some issue types are unavailable..." warning regardless of the field configuration and/or workflow association. I could reproduce this problem with fresh JIRA Cloud instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Just opening QuickCreate/Edit dialog reproduced this bug.

h3. Expected Results

The waning message should be shown appropriately according to the field configuration and/or workflow association.

h3. Actual Results

The warning message was always shown regardless of the field configuration and/or workflow association as follows.

* QuickCreate/Edit dialog
!create_issue.png|thumbnail!
* The each issue type is using the same field configuration
!field_configuration.png|thumbnail!
* The each issue type is using the same workflow association
!workflow.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: QuickCreate/Edit dialog always shows "Some issue types are unavailable..." warning
